repositories.brief_summary: Eight PRs merged including memprof race condition fix, DWARF detection support, and `#show_constructor` type parameter fix
repositories.new_features_summary: DWARF version detection for Clang assembler, memprof race condition fix, and toplevel `#show_constructor` improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **DWARF version detection** for the Clang assembler added to configuration system, enabling proper debug information handling and fixing `test-in-prefix` for other-configs tests ([#14314](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14314)) by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27)
- Fixed **race condition** between memprof and the minor GC detected by ThreadSanitizer, where memprof configuration fields now stored on major heap instead of minor heap ([#14300](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14300), [#14304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14304)) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- Improved **`#show_constructor`** directive in toplevel to correctly print type parameters for non-GADT constructors by using actual constructor type parameters rather than type declaration parameters ([#14239](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14239))
- Always use `"I"` format specifier for `size_t` with mingw compilers, completing C99 stdint.h/inttypes.h fixed-width integer types migration ([#13656](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13656), [#14114](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14114), [#14308](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14308)) by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA)

repositories.brief_summary: One Directory per Package feature added, Dune self-pinning implemented, Melange improvements, and multiple bug fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Package directory isolation, automatic Dune self-pinning, conflict marker detection, and Melange compilation improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **One Directory per Package** feature introduces `(dir ..)` field in `dune-project` to associate directories with specific packages, enabling automatic filtering with `--only-packages` and preventing package mixing in the same directory ([#12614](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12614))
- **Automatic Dune self-pinning** ensures the running Dune version is used for build plans, preventing incompatibility issues where `dune pkg lock` could select packages incompatible with the installed Dune version ([#12583](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12583))
- **Conflict marker detection** in cram tests now supports Git, diff3, and Jujutsu markers via `(conflict error|ignore)` option, preventing accidental test runs with unresolved conflicts ([#12617](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12617), [#12616](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12616))
- **Melange cmj/cmi rule creation** now parallelized for improved build performance ([#12626](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12626))
- Fixed `include_subdirs qualified` to correctly select the closest module rather than the furthest when resolving name ambiguities ([#12607](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12607), [#12587](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12587))
- Fixed `dune init` to work with absolute paths instead of crashing ([#12601](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12601))
- **OxCaml development environment** added with three Nix devShells for testing bootstrap, building with OxCaml, and running OxCaml test cases ([#12582](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12582))

- **ocaml-lsp**: Configurable code lenses for nested bindings via `for_nested_bindings` option ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1567](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1567)) and metrics timestamp precision improved to sub-second measurement ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1565](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1565))
- **js_of_ocaml**: Fixed Wasm runtime `caml_floatarray_concat` type checking bug preventing crashes ([1621a19](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1621a19113ac2b89c0c018c305480101ad717d4b))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Runtime threading and GC improvements, mode system refinements, and LLVM backend development across compiler and tooling
group_summaries.new_features_summary: GC debugging control, phantom bindings, domain lock unification, and LLVM backend enhancements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **GC debugging control** added via `Xenable_segv_handler=0` tweak to disable SIGSEGV handler for better coredump analysis during segfaults ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4913](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4913))
- **Phantom bindings support** implemented in Flambda2 allowing debug information generation without keeping dead code alive, controlled via `-gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental` flag ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3937](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3937))
- **Domain locking unification** merging backup thread and systhreads locks into single mechanism, enabling Python interop with multi-domain programs ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4769](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4769))
- **Runtime4 TLS fix** for threads created via `caml_c_thread_register` ensuring proper thread-local storage initialization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4915](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4915))
- **LLVM backend** now implements `Dls_get` operation for domain-local storage access ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4903](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4903))
- **Mode hint improvements** providing clearer error messages for allocation and regional mode errors with full hint chains ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4917](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4917))
- **Regional mode printing** simplified to show "local to the parent region" consistently instead of special-cased "regional" ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4918](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4918))
- **Compiler crash fix** for width checking in record types with crossing annotations preventing segfaults ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4902](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4902))
- **Primitive simplification fix** resolving binding ordering bug when extra bindings were introduced during optimization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4923](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4923))
- **LLVM flag handling** updated in Merlin to ignore `-llvm-backend` and `-no-llvm-backend` flags, with `-llvm-path` moved to parametrized flags ([oxcaml/merlin#192](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/192))

group_summaries.activity_summary: Major preemption implementation, name mangling work, quotation fixes, and infrastructure improvements underway
group_summaries.activity:
- **Preemption support** under active development with 2500+ line draft PR affecting 62 files for concurrent execution control by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- **Name mangling scheme** advancing with reversible mangling for full module path reconstruction and demangling implementations for LLVM, Linux kernel, and binutils by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
